metadata.title: CVE-2022-1184 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/ext4/namei.c:dx_insert_block() in theLinux kernelâ€™s filesystem sub-component. This flaw allows a local attackerwith a user privilege to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-156-lowlatency - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-156-generic - 5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-214.225').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-156.173~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1143.148').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.172').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1107.115~18.04.1').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1114.125').
